question.text: Which of the following is incorrect for operon concept?

options.text: The sequence of structural gene in lac operon is ZYA where Z gene codes for hydrolytic  enzyme
Allolactose turns it on by binding with repressor protein
It is an inducible operon and controls catabolic reactions
Operator gene receives RNA polymerase to switch it off

solution.text: The functional unit of DNA having a group of genes regulated by a single promoter is termed as an operon. The operon holds the promoter, operator, and the structural genes which express to produce the necessary protein intron are not part of the operon. Lac operon is one of the most widely studied operon models. It was described by Francois Jacob and Jacques Monod in E. coli. The sequence of the structural genes in lac operon is ZYA where the Z gene codes for the hydrolytic enzyme, beta-galactosidase. Allolactose turns it on by binding with repressor protein. It is an inducible operon and controls catabolic reactions. The RNA polymerase binds to the promoter and switches the production of proteins regarding the structural genes.
